text:
give me the git command to reset my main branch to me the same as the origin branch

To reset your local main branch to match exactly what's on the remote origin branch, you can use either of these commands:

```git
git fetch origin
git reset --hard origin/main
```

Or as a single command:

```git
git reset --hard @{u}
```

⚠️ Warning: The --hard flag will discard all local changes and commits that haven't been pushed. Make sure you don't have any important uncommitted changes before running this command.

If you want to be more cautious, you can first check what changes will be discarded:
```git
git fetch origin
git diff main origin/main
```
summary: Git Reset Main to Remote Branch
